choices.D: Global Managers move all existing Local Manager configuration to the Global Manager.
choices.A: Global Managers move control plane to a central place.
choices.C: Global configurations are sent to all Local Managers.
choices.B: Configurations requiring protection against site failures must be configured in the Global Manager.

questions.question_text: Which functionality is provided by NSX Global Manager?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

B is the correct answer

NSX Federation Components: Global Manager

Global Manager provides the GUI and the REST APIs for configuring objects across geographical sites.

Global Manager offers the following functionality:
• Global configurations are sent to the relevant local managers.
• Global configurations are replicated to the standby GM.
• Configurations that require protection against site failures must be configured in Global Manager.
• During site onboarding, Global Manager offers you a choice to move the existing Local Manager configuration to Global Manager.

From VMware Cloud Foundation: Planning, Management, Operations 4.3 Lesson Book

Correct Answer is C.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/5.0/vcf-admin/GUID-6904A34A-1F67-4BBA-ACE8-12F039EC97E9.html

questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with replacing the default, self-signed certificates in a VMware Cloud Foundation environment.

The administrator begins by completing the three tasks which must be executed to prepare a Microsoft Active Directory Certificate Services authority to integrate with VMware Cloud Foundation.

Which three tasks were executed by the administrator? (Choose three.)

choices.F: Enable Basic authentication for Certificate Services.
choices.E: Create a new template that supports Server Authentication and proof of origin.
choices.A: Join the vCenter server instances to the Active Directory domain.
choices.C: Enable Active Directory authentication for Certificate Services.
choices.D: Assign the “Issue and Manage Certificates” permission to the SDDC Manager service account.
choices.B: Modify the “Web Server” template to include User Authentication.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DEF
The only logical answer given the choices is DEF. But based on this link, the documentation explicitly says to Remove Server Authentication from the template. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-admin/GUID-194B5856-8B2C-40D3-AEC2-DD4324980C05.html
So answer "E" is suspect. Maybe it's a bad question.

Selected Answer: DEF
Correct Answer is : DEF
